title: Seeking nerdy, sweet, gentle, loving, kindhearted
text:
Latina, 41 in search of my Super Nerdy (White) Hero

The things I would like out of this special friendship are, someone that I can connect with physically as well as intellectually. Someone I can have deep meaningful conversations to the lightest with! :) Someone to laugh and cry with. Share everything and anything, at full trust! Our secrets and only ours! Like special friends, soul mates... We can hangout, go out for lunch or dinner, have picnics, go for walks, hikes, travel/seek adventure, people watch, go to movies, or stay in, cook for each other, or together, teach me how to play videos games if you are a gamer?? =D haha. Put a flower in your head..or two! :) Be silly or cheesy together... cuddle, love each other. Simply just be together whenever we feel like, whenever life allows us to. I would like to find someone that I can care for and love, and in return do the the same for me. My heart is big and I would like to share it with someone special. It can be whatever we want it to be, as long as it is something meaningful.

I have been described by men as beautiful, cute, sexy, fun, funny, sweet and caring. To describe myself, I am caring, compassionate, passionate, hopeless romantic, sentimental, silly at times, but know when to be serious. I am a strong woman who can be vulnerable at times and I am not ashamed to say so. I have my flaws and I am very aware of them. They have helped me to learn and grow, better myself. They have made me the strong woman I am today, more and more each day. I am, simply put, a bubbly introvert.

I am attracted to younger men and they have always been attracted to me. We have always felt comfortable with each other, a special connection. I have been told I make them feel free, unleashed! And I too have always felt the same.

My preference is between the ages of mid 30's to early 40's. I am attracted to slender build (average, depending on what you define average as. Haha), shy, introverted (I find this trait rather sweet, cute, attractive!), white/Caucasian guys, fair skinned with light eyes. Green, blue... No tattoos (well actually...It depends. How big are we talking and how many??). I am sorry, but it's what I like, and I have a right to my preference. It is what it is! As you have a right to yours!

title: Life is too short not to have an affair
text:
I know that most people only browse CL for entertainment value...to see if anything can still shock their jaded sensibilities, but there are messages of genuine substance to be discovered...even here. 

I'm looking for the woman who is unhappily married but who needs to stay married for practical reasons. The woman who lacks intimacy in and out of the bedroom. What I don't want is lunch time sex. I want a woman that has the flexibility to experience life with me outside the bedroom as well. I want someone who I think about when I wake up in the morning and when I lay down at night. I want the woman who makes my heart sing when I hear her voice on my phone or get an email from her.. 

Making love is incredible when relationships are nurtured and emotional bonds are formed. I have no plans to leave the marriage that I'm in -- it's just too complicated -- but I'm not willing to live out the rest of my life unfulfilled either. 

There must be a woman who finds herself in a similar situation -- a woman who is ready to build a long-term, secondary relationship. 
Honestly, the concept of an affair seems quite easy. Two attached people make a decision to mess around and well the rest is history. However, the more complicated question is how do those two attached people make it known that they are open to such an arrangement.

About me: 

Others would typically describe me as being laid back, very funny, considerate, respectful, spontaneous and at time shy. I like sports , reading, beach/camping, independent and mainstream films, dancing, hiking, road trips, Cooking, Cricket and good restaurants ( who doesn't). But I would trade them all for a night of warmth and cuddling at home in front of a good movie and some great take out food... Care to join...(wink)


About you: 

The woman I am looking for married like me but is starved for intimacy and ready for a sensual and cerebral adventure. I am discerning and patient; this is only worth doing if it really feels right. She has darker hair and eyes...maybe olive complexion...she might be of Latin, Mediterranean, Asian, or mixed heritage. For that matter, she could be a striking brunette of any origin....the dark features are just my preference. She is fit and feminine. Her hands are soft and graceful...they fit nicely in my large grasp. 

Naturally none of us should be into games or one-nighters! If we are on the same page about what we want, send me an email -- possibly to explore this discreet, adventurous new friendship

title: come and listen to my story about
text:
A man named jed A poor mountaineer, barely kept his family fed,

I used to watch the Beverly hillbillies reruns after school. life was good at home , but not at school where I was bullied and it wasn't a big deal like it is today.I remember my dad not liking me becuz I was fat, they divorced when I was in fourth grade My mom was super nice and I acted out and she didn't know why. I didn't tell her how miserable I was back then. Bless her heart. she is a great mom and I love her. I now take care of her since she has become handicapped and ill.
Im scared, I know she won't be with me for a long time. I hurt so much inside. I can't break down and show my weakness. I have to be strong for people that depend on me.
I already know I need to see someone , Im not looking for that answer,I do get exercise, I used to be a buffed guy 3 years ago, but no gym for me right now. can't take on any bills at all, having someone to talk with would be nice. I don't have many friends anymore. Guess Im just lame . I no longer have a lust for life do to all the financial crisis I am in. they say misery loves company. does anyone relate ? or I am a lost cause? I don't care if I get rude answers or spam. its easy to delete and go to the next.
I am in a reality of my own doing. I think its stupid to profess your a real person .even spam and scams are written by real people. ugh..
is anyone there? hello? can you hear me?
I don't think I am fat slob, but I can tell people are not as nice or friendly because of the extra lbs I have, I get told I look mean or look like a cop. I'm withdrawn and numb. not mean or violent. 
a distraction from my world is what I seek.

title: From here to eternity. Yeah maybe not
text:
Ah yes. I can see it now -- the flow of email messages into my Inbox (cowardly masked by CL of course) telling me I am a fool. Or too wordy. Or misguided. 

But I am going to write this post and ignore the naysayers and cynics. Of course they exist in this cesspool. But relationships are all the more valuable, more meaningful and loved when one chances upon a diamond in the rough when rowing in the cesspool.

ISO a kind, attentive, romantic and adventurous woman who wants to start as friends and then move on to something more meaningful as if we are simpatico. I respect my own time so very assiduously, and hope that you are much the same. For it would mean that you are perceptive, worldly, empathetic and can hold your own without being judgmental of others. That's a rare bird.

But I have a thing for rare birds. Write and tell me your tale.

If anyone asks I'll deny it, because, you know, I am a guy and all. But I'm a wee bit lonely. And discouraged. Which makes me the guy for you! Actually, this IS in the "strictly platonic" category, and if I know anything about Craigslist, it's that everyone here adheres to the designated categories. So I'm not looking, per se, merely casually, slyly perusing under the universal safe word "platonic." Or maybe I'm not doing that at all. Maybe I'm a hapless wonder who can recite every line from "Princess Bride" and really think the Bay area is everything wonderful and beautiful.

If you're still reading, congratulations on being literate (I'm all about positive reinforcement ;) ). If you're entertained, you're welcome. 

I used to think I was the eternal optimist. It turns out, the longer I'm in this place in life, the shorter eternity gets.

Etymology
Variant of Platonic, which see. The sense "non-sexual" dates to the 17th century in English, and to the 15th century in Latin; see platonic love for details.

Pronunciation
(UK) IPA(key): /pləˈtɒnɪk/
(US) IPA(key): /pləˈtɔnɪk/
Adjective
platonic ‎(comparative more platonic, superlative most platonic)

Not sexual in nature; being or exhibiting platonic love.
They are good friends, but their relationship is strictly platonic.
Alternative letter-case form of Platonic (of or relating to the philosophical views of Plato and his successors).

title: Attentive Attention
text:
I am a husband and father who enjoys receiving massage. I admire and value the sacred space created by practitioners, to heal the body and quiet the mind. Bodywork has proven integral to my well being, as both a pleasant and practical form of facilitated meditation.

But a massage isn't something I can afford to have often. So, instead of paying to feel this way, I'd rather massage others for free. Performing bodywork lets me repay the patience, generosity, and attention that I received on the table. Moreover, I gain a very different sense of myself, which is truly a gift all its own.

My offer is simple, straight forward, and easy to attain: have a body that you want massaged. We'll coordinate schedules, then meet once, or regularly. My intention is to heal, connect with, and relieve your physical body.

I am a professional Black male, in my late thirties, of average weight and height. My personality type (ENTP) emphasizes thinking over feeling, which explains this lengthy post and my pursuit of sensate connections. My wife understands me best of course, and is my rock in this endeavor. She recognizes my need to be used, tasked, and encouraged by women. Through this ad, she is allowing you to do just that.

I've offered my time and attention via Craigslist in the past, and may provide references - if not, testimonials. I'm available for 1 to 3 hour sessions, most evenings, weekends, and Fridays. You can visit my modest Berkeley studio, or I can travel to you, within 30 minutes of Lake Merritt. I own a portable table, use draping, and have been privileged to work with various body types, abilities and conditions.

Please note that I am merely a student of touch, with no formal training. If you have any relevant ailments or medically diagnosed concerns, you are strongly advised to inform me. I can research and prepare, but ultimately trust that you know your health best. Above all else, I encourage feedback, and will dutifully adjust my stroke for your comfort.

My style is an intuitive mix of Swedish, Esalen, Lomi Lomi, and Thai stretches. I'm also familiar with the sacrum, psoas, glutes, adductors, and some lymph systems. You're welcome to inquire about your preferred modality as well - learning them expands my capacity to serve. Whatever the request or preference, I aim to deliver what you need to relax.

I welcome all inquiries. The most common one asks why I do this for free. While there is no fee, your presence and attention are invaluable. Caring for others helps me focus, open up emotionally, and simply be grateful. Giving is a chance to be present, which allows me to see my own patterns and solve my own problems, more easily. Not only is money a hurdle to having these moments, it often diminishes their value.

I hope to have written enough that you might respond with the same confidence, good faith and gratitude that I've attempted to display. Should you reply, please include a reasonable introduction, and what you can about your unique massage goals, needs, and/or concerns. Simply include your photo if you would like mine, in kind. Otherwise, expect to voice verify or meet and greet before booking. Finally, title your response "somatic healing", so I might weed out spam.

Thank you for reading all of this through. Be well!

I love trying new things and it doesn't have to be all about sex but I do want that as part of the agreement. I'm sure you appreciate straightforwardness. 

I love a girl who can still wear heels when we stand next to each other. Don't count yourself out if you're petite :) I'm over 6ft, cute, tall and considered a handsome man. I'm disease free and will always try to make time for someone who's good in bed and a great friend. I'm looking for someone cute with a great personality, brain, and sense of humor! I'm looking for a long term friend with benefits, not just a one time, nsa thing. A weekly stipend is what I was thinking and I'm good for it.

If this is what you're looking for please share what your expectations for a stipend type of arrangement would be like? How many times a week do you think realistically you could meet up? Are you single? Is your place available some of the time or would we always have to come to my place? When you write feel free to ask me any questions you may have. Please tell me a bit about yourself as well as send some good pictures. I will be happy to answer anything and send pictures of myself.

When an attractive guy has an education and a good job, people ask why is he still single this late in the game? Girls ask specifically, "What's wrong with him?" I'll be perfectly honest. I've had back to back long term traditional relationships before having an arrangement and this is something that just works for me right now. I plan on settling down one day but the problem right now is that I work and travel a lot. 

I really, really like my job, and unfortunately it requires me to go places on short-notice. I do a lot of driving all over California and along the West. My schedule gets in the way of dating and this situation works perfectly for a student or someone who has equal needs. I don't think it would be an issue if I had a long-term girlfriend, but it's a big problem when you're trying to get past the first few dates just getting to know each other and the girl discovers that my schedule is just all over the map.

The girl I'm looking for is anywhere between 5'2''-5'9'' with blonde, brunette or red hair. She has blue, green or hazel eyes and is slim and takes care of herself. I'm open to HWP as long as you take care of yourself and stay healthy and active. I love a girly girl but also a girl who doesn't mind getting her hands dirty. I'm open to different ethnic groups. :) 

With all of this said, are you that someone who's open to a friend's-with-benefits scenario while being compensated for it? I'm pretty sexual and frankly it's difficult to find somebody who can accommodate my schedule. I think if we didn't expect a big emotional commitment from each other then maybe it would be simpler. I'm not really interested in being a "player." No games. To be honest, I'm not opposed if we do end up developing feelings for each other but that's down the road. Who knows what could happen....

title: Intellectual Depression Support Friend?
text:
While I find self-identifications like "intellectual" to be smug, pretentious and mostly ill-fitting for someone like me, it nonetheless seemed like a catchy subject title that might attract a less perverted, more refined cross-section of people. 

Having briefly perused the personals on here on both the mens' and womens' sides, I am not writing this post with a wide-eyed hope for a multitude of promising responses. But I do hope that among the numerous responses I will receive from the multitudes of swine (who will no doubt attach gratuitous genitalia pictures,) and from hostile misanthropic jerks with a penchant for writing scathing insults, that a few pearls might emerge. What constitutes a pearl among swine? I am not sure. If I am pearl myself, I certainly feel lackluster.

So about me...I am a university student in my twenties, and I suffer from a chronic depression with some rather debilitating stripes. I do not have any problems identifying the indispensable good and positive growth that has come out of my experience with academia, but the bad (the elitism, the enormously sensitive egos of some academics, the condescension, the competition, the demoralizing criticism, and the sometimes poor regard for ethical, fair treatment), has left me disillusioned. I sometimes wonder if I will continue onto graduate school or not. At this point, I have far from realized career ambitions that I entertain with fluctuating hope. The future feels dauntingly precarious, and I am not very good at smiling into the uncertain abyss and welcoming the unexpected tide.

My depression includes hours of wallowing, sulking and brooding. I often lay around draping blankets over myself producing a cavernous effect and ruminating over the pain I have, focusing closely on the pain so that interjections of hope and positive thinking are reduced to sounding like irritating whispers. I often dwell over haunting memories of social humiliation, events of social humiliation that could have been avoided had I been more prudent and reserved about the things I chose to say and write. I do, it seems, have a history of social error associated with a poor regard for diplomatic politics or a poor regard for knowing which battles to pick, and not letting go of my anger, and instead saying and/or writing all the wrong things to express my anger. I sometimes construct "what if" hypotheticals and imagine the favorable outcomes that might have occured had I behaved properly and not committed the social errors. My depression also includes a rather self-loathing, hopeless internal monologue marked by variations of saying to myself: "I am ugly. I am in adequate. I am not intelligent enough. I am a failure. Life is pointless. Why do I bother?" I do not entertain existential questions about the meaning of life with a gallant curiosity, but rather a morbid defeatism. To many it is not troubling that life is inherently meaningless and that one needs to give it meaning, but to me this meaning assignment feels contrived and artificial. I'd much rather life have meaning independent of the meaning I could ever assign to it, and that some higher power (not necessarily a supernatural deity) could spell things out for me. This is a very common sentiment, I know. Feel free to yawn or scowl at how terribly banal my troubles are.

In spite of this debiliating depression, I guess I am moderately-high functioning. I am functional enough to perform decently to quite well on my my coursework, and attend courses on school days. I am functional enough to entertain fluctuating hopes and ambitions. I am functional enough to sometimes look for inspiration and a spark to carry on. I am functional enough to see if I can be more resilient. I am functional enough to write this ad, (though taking the time to post something like this in a place like this probably speaks more to dysfunction.)

So I am reaching my quivering hand into this cyber cesspool in hopes that I might find someone similar, someone who has been in this cavern, or who is still there, or who has emerged and has been on a mostly upwards trajectory since. My hope is that after exchanging many detailed, introspective, psycho-analytic, thoughtful letters and discussions with a like-minded person, that I might find something short of catharsis if not a greater, less fluctuating will to live. My hope is also to derive meaning and self-importance from being valued similarly in someone else's life -- if not valued as a pillar of support to someone, then as an indispensibly special person to them. And finally, my hope is to build a connection that makes me eventually feel strong enough to not feel I have to lean on others. I would like to be strong enough to one day stand on my own feet.

There are certain personality/mental types I particularly favor: I like someone who has a dominant, assertive personality, but a dominant personality who does not lead with a controlling and/or arrogant foot, but who leads rather with a firm confidence as well as a compassionate regard for my views and preferences. I favor someone who is very reassuring and who won't grow tired or conspicuously annoyed with giving me assurances. I like someone who won't consider dealing with my depression to be a task or burden. (At worst, you may find dealing with my depression an ethical duty, but it best I would hope you derive some happiness and self-importance from it.) I like someone who is good at reading non-verbals (since I can be a timid, awkward communicator) and someone who can be forward and caring enough in their communication style to help me communicate better. I like a very conciliatory person who won't receive my grievances in defensive anger and criticism and who is instead constructive enough to listen to them, not walk away, and try to mend the rupture and reconcile. I like someone who appreciates very candid psychological admissions and who can reciprocate in such candid discussions and eventually not hold anything back about his life. I like someone who can stomach and respond compassionately to graphic detail regarding morbid ideation instead of recoiling in repulsion and abandoning me. I favor someone who will not flake and have unexplained absences, and someone who is intent on building an enduring connection and who has enough time and sense of commitment to keep in regular touch.

While psychologically, emotionally intimate discussions can set the scene for a budding romance, I imagine an amorous connection could potentially impede or complicate my aim for managing my depression (as well as your aim for managing depression, if that is your aim.) But I am open, in due time, to warm embraces and platonic affectionate gestures. I think this is an important barrier and that we should honor it for the sake of our health and for the sake of ensuring an enduring connection.

After exchanging thoughtful letters, texts and phone calls, I imagine these sorts of outings: taking BART from city to city and getting off at your favorite stops where you will lead the way, catching a good movie at a movie theatre, drinking hot tea while walking around a lake at night, lying down on the grass or sitting on a bench and sharing our ruminations and dreams, me resting my head on your shoulder as you comment elaboratively and sometimes humorously on the people who walk by, going on long bike rides at night with music with you leading the way and caring for me if I clumsily get injured, engaging in unabashed voyeurism at quirky venues or in general, looking at antique furniture together (which you will know more about than me), going to museums (which you will be better at talking your way through), reading to one another, sitting and listening to music together (preferring melancholy scores over sulking excessively with the painful tracks of The Smiths, Neil Young, Bob Dylan, Elliott Smith, Joni Mitchell and Radiohead etc.,) me spending a weekend at your far from bio-hazardous relatively clean place where we watch movies together, eat well, rearrange your living space if you find that fitting and have staring contests cut by interludes of shouting non sequiturs and obnoxious giggling if not flatulence. Finally, I imagine coming out of our time spent together feeling uplifted, stronger, hopeful, needed and important. I imagine feeling that I have secured a long-term comrade and confidant. But maybe that is an all too loaded, idealistic and thus dangerous expectation to have. Perhaps I ought to look forward to what pleasant time someone can offer while they can offer it and appreciatively live in the moment and condition myself to expect less since one of my self-help aims is learning to be less needy and dependent and expectant. 

I thought I would end this ad (which will no doubt attract gratuitous genitalia photos and insults like "You think you have it so bad, huh?" or "You sound so pretentious and demanding!" or unsolicited trite advice like "Just get out more! Be positive!"), by listing some academic interests/pursuits: journalism, social welfare, sociology (an intersectional perspective that accounts for race, class, sexuality and other social stigma), doing archival/historical research, rhetoric/argumentation, social activist efforts, ethnic and gender studies, African diaspora studies, history (early to present U.S., medieval to modern Europe, South Asia and the Middle East, th ancient Near East, etc.,) political science (early to present party ideology and party politics, voter habits, race and gender in party politics), critiquing idealogues and pop culture, film studies, comparative literature (deconstruction, literary theory, semiotics, the activity of interpretation/comparing interpretation methods, assessing which and why what literary interpretations are more optimal than others, comparing Enlightenment era thinkers, etc.), philosophy (have been largely unsuccessful with Kant, Wittgenstein, Frege and many others,) etc.

Well, fellow depression-survivor, I look forward to hearing from you. Feel free to write at length -- I do appreciate detail and a thoughtfulness for crafting prose, be it a less controlled prose style reminiscent of the melodramatic introspection of Virginia Woolf or Proust, or the more controlled, snide, economical command for epigram of Oscar Wilde, mixed in with the somehow endearing bitterness of Allen Ginsberg. I like many types of writing and writers, (so long as you do not seem too eerily close to Nolan's protagonist from "Following.") In your response, please tell me your age, what you do (work, school, etc), what your daily routine is like, how much free time you have in your schedule for keeping in touch (I favor regular texting at the very least and weekly if not bi-monthly outings), what area you live in, whether or not you like going on long drives, what your interests/hobbies are, what is the nature of your depression, what treatments you have already tried and what you hope to change, what you hope to get out of our correspondence, why you choose to live, etc.

Making love is incredible when relationships are nurtured and emotional bonds are formed. I have no plans to leave the marriage that I'm in -- it's just too complicated -- but I'm not willing to live out the rest of my life unfulfilled either.

title: Female Road Trip Buddy
text:
I've been exploring CA for years. I've been to Death Valley eleven times and I especially, love deserts and wide open spaces.

I'm a very youthful retired late middle-aged woman (I have many friends in their 40s and 50s). Road trips for me include easy hiking and exploring local towns' thrift stores and shops. I'm quite flexible about duration of trips, from day-trips, to one or two nights or longer. My biggest problem in retirement has been finding women who have the time, money and desire to hit the road without much of an agenda. 

I have a wide range of interests and I love to laugh. I don't get my knickers in a twist over much. I'm a writer and big reader.

You must be able to pull your own weight and share expenses such as gas and lodging. 

Spontaneity and a sense of humor and curiosity are absolutely essential. 

The point of road trips is to take a break from daily life so please be able to disconnect from electronica except for basic checking in with relatives and such. I don't want to find myself staring at the top of your head as you text and photograph your food.

Let's talk and meet and see if we're on the same page. The days are getting longer and I'll soon be rarin' to go. I have a brand new Kia Rio and a GPS. It's easier if you're in or near San Francisco, but not essential.

I'm not averse to tent camping, and still have my equipment.

title: Seeking hiking partners M4MorW
text:

My favorite hike's are in Mill Valley but anywhere in the north bay is great for hikes. Pacifica is also full of great hikes. The hike I find to be the most grueling is Mt Diablo, especially in the summer when it's hot out. My go-to hike is San Bruno Mt, and I can usually string those trails together for 10 miles.

As for me, I'm 35, fairly athletic, an ambivert(introvert/extrovert) if I'm going to put a label on myself; I'm friendly(people actually tell me this) and outgoing, but enjoy the peace and calm of nature. I'm a great listener, great at communication, into psychology, and the human condition. I'm well traveled and can converse with pretty much anyone who speaks my language.

My best friends are married with children so they aren't available as much as I'd like them to be, and I broke up with my girlfriend 6 months ago so I'm still figuring out how to occupy that time she filled. Not heartbroken if that's what you're thinking. Let me know if you'd like to meet, thanks

title: Lonely Abuse Survivor Seeks Cuddle Buddy
text: I know the title sounds dramatic, but the reality is that while I'm mostly healed from my childhood sexual and physical abuse emotionally, yet I'm still at a point where I find it very hard to be intimate and connect with women in a dating context. I've had 3 short relationships in the past 10 years and been alone the rest of the time. When single, I don't date casually or "hook up", which means I go long periods of time without any kind of physical contact and comfort. Lately I'm really missing the emotional support it provides and because of how busy I am with some new work endeavors, I have no time to date. So if I could find a kind, generous girl to be a good friend and non-sexual cuddle buddy it would really give me something I've been sorely lacking and missing and would provide emotional/physical support as pursue my new career goals. Also, please don't judge this, but I would prefer an Asian or Indian woman simply because I've spent a lot of time in that part of the world and feel more at peace there and thus I've found a greater ability to detach from the normal associations of my past abuse in intimate/physical contact with Asian/Indian women.

title: homesteader needed in lucerne
text:
I am looking for someone who is in need of a place to live (no income needed) and who will help with projects around the house, starting a garden, composting, cleaning, organizing, etc. I am currently overwhelmed with life in general and the craziness that I have surrounded myself with at this time. I need positivity around me as well as someone who can help get me motivated.

I am 31years old and not very social. I have given up on finding love and instead I am looking for a partner(s) who want to eventually homestead (and can start small today) and who have similar ideals and values. I live on a small lot in Lucerne, ca. It is not a large yard however I want to find someone to assist me in my quest for sustainability. I eventually (next two years max) will find a large acreage where I can homestead full time with all sorts of animals and crops and this person would be willing to start over with me when I buy more property.

this would be the perfect fit for someone who is nonjudgmental, positive, friendly, does't smoke or use tobacco products or drugs (although others on the property smoke cigs another would be too much for me and eventually I would like the property to be smoke free), there is alcohol consumed here although it doesn't typically get out of hand. You must love dogs (as I have many) and all living creatures/things. 

I am 420 friendly, although I don't smoke, and I am open to all kinds of individuals as well as ages (over 18) who are willing to work towards self-sufficientcy and achieving shared dreams. You have to be willing to put in a lot of effort and this is not a task for the faint of heart but your efforts will be rewarded long term.

A bit about the property and living situation:it is not a desirable situation for someone with other viable alternatives. There is often complete chaos within the group that lives in the mobile home and they will perhaps attempt to sabotage our efforts at communal living which is why someone who is generally understanding of the pressures that come from trying to escape poverty and homelessness, calm under pressure and does not react to ignorance or verbally combative conversations is a must. We are great in some ways though -we share, we care and are trying to be better as a group and individuals (some more than others)and if you are willing to put in the effort to get along with us and our craziness you will fit in and perhaps we can grow and learn with each other.

Please put homesteader in the subject line of any reply so that I know you are real and not a robot and include a bit about you, what you have going on in your life (your current situation) and your expectations as far as what you are willing and not willing to live with and anything you feel you would like to add. As a side note I will remove this posting once I find someone.

title: Totally Friendship - You, Unattached Woman: 50+
text:
Hi - If you are a woman, unattached, over Age 50 and like what you read below, I would like to hear from you with a little background and your personal goals. Photo is appreciated. 

A little about me: 

Relocated to the bay area from NJ/NY, in 1979. Yes, I miss the Big Apple and hope to go back and visit. 

Mild-mannered gentleman, College-Educated, non-judgmental, non-smoker, Fit/Healthy, romantic, financially & emotionally secure. I grew up travelling throughout Europe and the Middle East, because my dad was a international bank executive tasked with helping establishing bank branches, in many major cities in Europe and the middle east. I finally landed in NJ/NY area in 1970. My college and grad schooling were in upstate NY (Troy, NY).

Started my semi retirement, in early 2014.

My friends describe me as fun to be around, respectful, well-rounded, witty, calm, honest, compassionate, kind, sensitive, romantic & affectionate.. there are few more, I hope you discover'em! (Nooooooo, I am not near perfect - nor trying to be).

The outdoors, gardening, cooking, dancing, ethnic cuisine, sunsets, music, the theatre, classic movies, travel, moonlights.... & Life are among the things I enjoy.

I am fluent in French (the language).

I am not deterred by body type, religion, skin color or ethnicity so long we connect comfortably and harmoniously. I have a catholic background, but I am not fanatic about it. Among other components, I find Balance, Kindness, Sanity & Harmony are essential in Life.

My taste in music gravitates around Jazz, Classic Rock, World music... 

I prefer a romantic candlelight dinner with music, by the fireplace, to watching TV.

Meanwhile, Happy Holidays!

title: WOMAN ON SPIRITUAL HEART PATH SEEKS NEW FRIENDS
text:
LOOKING FOR NEW FRIENDS in the Northbay. I just moved to Santa Rosa from the Eastbay-- If this all resonates with you, please write me. Blessings to all to find the friends that are best for you.

I'd love to meet people that deeply mirror enough of my path and stages of growth so we can easily understand each other, feel compassion and provide support for each other. I'm new to the SF Northbay, I have a couple friends in the Eastbay but would like friends here to share my life stories and growth and listen to your life stories and growth. I'm looking for someone similar to me---already on a spiritual heart path. I'm a regular type person yet born heart-evolved, young at heart, a Lightworker, age 60, attractive, about to begin another part of my journey, the main portion of my Divine Life Purpose work. Desire someone to share life experiences, ups and downs, on our ongoing growth paths, with compassionate healing focuses on all levels-- mental emotional physical spiritual financial but mostly like to keep things simple, and focused on the heart, with deep self compassion and compassion for others. 

I am currently preparing to do a variety of work to create a financial foundation, dogwalking, groceryshopping, while I prepare to become an Angel Therapist (helping others connect to their Angels for healing all parts of their life). I do embrace basic spiritual laws like Ask & you will receive, and pay attention to your own beliefs to find blockages to receiving,etc but I mostly keep a grounded and honest focus, although I am basically an optimist with faith I also have a simple discerning tool that regularly sees red flags in myself and life so I can help heal or release things. Also I use basic humanistic psychology to see relationship dynamics needing to be healed in the world, with others and within oneself, often originating from one's childhood family issues, etc. My view of the world is that we are all blessed by the Divine and all have access to the Divine, and we all are receiving Divine assistance to bring thru healing for humanity and the earth, one person at a time, based on freewill choices. 

I'm also aware of the Sonoma State University archives of Project Censored, and the corporate greed going on. But mostly I just like to focus on creating a simple, grounded, compassionate life for myself and close friends. And would love to have someone to go with to the park and the river, and maybe some other event we could enjoy together. I'm becoming a vegetarian soon, and I'm trying to get in shape by simple stretching, but don't do any intense strenuous activity, although I used to dance and will be doing so again. 

I am a basically compassionate person and don't harm others, and need a friend who is similar, I am not judgemental but I am getting very clear about what type of support is nourishing for me. I need a little head but a lot of heart too. I'm not very emotional exactly, but I can be passionate about social justice issues, and when my heart is open I can cry in empathy with tears. Looking for a friend in the same ballpark, so we can support each other, but also have access to our own intuitive guidance and listen to our own inner wisdom and bodywisdom. So we don't need to do much of anything but be compassionate witnesses for each other, and just both of us share and both of us listen. I'm planning on following Christiane Northrup book, Goddesses Never Age. 

Although I've been on a spiritual path, my childhood background has been to come from a more traditional background, so I had to work hard to release beliefs that interfered with my desired process, so in that way my orientation still reflects a much more grounded approach to all my work, simple, kind, loving, open, transparent, is how I approach the work and myself, so I still sometimes struggle as I'm creating a solid and fully self-loving perspective that will be perfect for me, healthy and grounded. I believe that many teachers don't realize how much they use anti-human language that disconnects them from their own feelings, authentic process, and natural comfort zone and body wisdom. I like to keep my path, my work, and my perspectives very simple and very grounded and very human oriented. If this all resonates with you simply and deeply, please write me. Looking forward to meeting you.

title: I simply don't give a fuck...
text:
And neither should you. The sanctity of marriage is something we've created in our minds to address what seems to be a state of disorder. Some of you know this to be true and giggle about it as you browse these personals with your "Bestie". 

But you return to the vicious circle, a sucker for punishment. A life of servitude with little focus on the best things in life. A constant battle to silence your intuition. 

Oh, I can almost feel some of you begin to extend your claws, poised for attack. But I'm impervious! A layer of thick skin and a suit of chain mail and fresh filters installed. I speak not to the woman reading this but her innermost "questionable" desires. 

I won't sit here and dictate the sort of arrangement or relationship I'm looking for. It's far too dynamic. If you are a bitch, we will feed off of that and address it aggressively. If you are sweet and submissive, we will take things slowly and enjoy terms of mutual respect. If you are lonely and in need of attention, prepare to feel wholesome but don't expect a one way street. 

So get busy! Quit spending your morning coffee browsing ads and write something meaningful instead!

Cheers,

X.

title: Looking for someone special --to be friends first...

title: MONOPOLY
text:
Minding your own damn business, you wander into Safeway. Maybe it was for some toilet paper? Frozen fish filets? Maybe some bagged salad? The cashier hands you a sealed green monopoly piece. You think, "the hell am I going to do with this?" But you feel the urge to accept it and smile. You fight your way through the parking lot where grandma is parked just a little too close to you, your gas light came on, and you're tired because Frank who lives next door was riding the pound town express all night (wait? was he calling out my name?). Green monopoly still in your grasp, you throw it on the passenger seat of your car, wasted like your prom night, never to be thought of again. 

Over and over this happens. Pretty soon you have so many of those godforsaken green monopoly pieces!! They're everywhere. After a while you finally open one up, my guess- a fucking paper cut!! "Ain't that some bull shit!!" You vow to rid these annoying green monopoly pieces. 

That's where I come in. I'm old, boring and totally get a lady boner collecting these things. If you're wanting good karma, and to totally help me get my rocks off. Send me your unopened green monopoly pieces.

title: no better time than now!
text:
I am hoping to meet an attached lady with whom I can fall into conversation about anything and everything and the meaning of it all.

You know, the kind of conversations that can only be really held with a stranger.

You may ask: "Couldn't you have these conversations with your spouse?" Well, if you've been married for a while you already know that while we all need to talk about metaphysics, those who know us well want details and specifics, while strangers allow us to operate more vaguely on a cosmic scale....

When the talk occurs between two people that don't know each other, it gathers a special charge. After all, you can only say "I feel like I've known you for years" to someone you have *not* known for years :)

Funny how your spouse doesn't understand the bittersweet transience of life as well as a stranger encountered in a hotel bar or here on craigslist....

title: Married Man Looking for Special Discreet Friendship
text:
Thanks for reading my ad and I am glad I caught your attention. I went back and forth with how I ought to title this ad and finally landed on advertising for a "special discreet friendship." This is my first foray into the world of seeking such a friendship since being married. I am simply interested in making my life a little more exciting, giving it an extra kick, having some intrigue. While I am still very much attached to my wife, the passion has somehow slipped away and my relationship has dulled over time. It is very comfortable, but not exciting. Do you feel that way? It may be that you and I just email each other some spicy titillating (although respectful) emails; it may be that we decide to discreetly meet and chat over coffee/tea, or maybe explore things further if we are both mutually inclined. There are lots of possibilities. As far as I am concerned, we can't go wrong...

I am a Caucasian man, tall, attractive, stocky, gym-goer, early fifties, advanced degrees, professional, live and work in San Francisco, clean-cut, respectful, and very discreet. I would love to hear from women -- married or single between the ages of 25 and 60 -- who, for whatever reasons, want to engage in a friendship in which all limits are respected yet at the same time exploration is in the cards (whether that be through e-mails, meet ups, etc.). I am honestly very open about how all of this might unfold. In the end, I do not wish to negatively impact my marriage and I don't want you (or your spouse/partner) hurt in any way; this is a very important value I hold dear and to which I am committed. 

I hope you are further intrigued by reading my ad and I hope to hear from you. I will reply to all who respond to my ad. Please tell me a bit about yourself (age, description, and any information about yourself that you would like to share) and what compelled you to answer my ad. What is your situation at the moment? What would you hope for out of a special friendship like this? I'll promise to get in touch with you soon.

I very much look forward to hearing from you... To know for sure that your email is not coming from a (ro)bot, please put the name of your favorite city in the subject line of your email. Thanks again and I hope to hear from you.

title: Seeking transformation
text:
I have been experiencing the desire to help those in need. Especially those who have been mentally ill and depressed. 

I've been mentally depressed and have battled against it since childhood. I know it comes with a feeling of emptiness and accompanied by the feeling of loneliness. If there was a map to mental depression, I couldn't find it. At times, I didn't even realize how I got to that point that was so low. I was lost and often unable to find the words to describe such a horrible place. It had to have been a place because I often stayed there until I was ready to come out.

Many times I would slip into depression after I was hurt and unable to continue fighting. I had no energy to sustain where I was at or where I was headed. My life became the reflection of my inside. I often worked 45+ hours a week, (plus commute), didn't cook for myself and often times dated people who could not receive or give love. (Objective view)

I think at my lowest point I had a short stay at a mental faculty where the only thing I'd allow myself to think was being present because death seemed more friendlier than this interior pain.

Still I chugged along, in and out of therapy. I think after one of my last dating fiasco I decided to do something simple and look for friendship. There is was online, on Craigslist and I posted a simple ad. I had a few replies, but this one raised my eyebrow.

This man had replied and said that I had contradicted myself in my ad. He said that in my words and my ads I was looking for truthful friendships and relationships but I had a too much makeup on and that my expression was an expression for the camera and not actual life.

Long story short he helped show me my own truth. It was not a conventional friendship, but it was a very life lesson friendship. He was me in the past. (Our birthdays were exactly 41 years)

Everyday I still learning about spirit. As my mind continues to think.

If you can understand any of this message, I may be able to help you. I think a lot of us don't know spirit and our mind can play many tricks on us. I would like to show you of you, you are in individual. You are made of two. Indivisible duo=individual. If you would like I can share with you my knowledge of the language and some of the 'secrets' it holds for us. Although the words do not have secrets it is our perception of the word that will make us overlook the obviousness of its definition. 

I hope if I can't help you, you will find your way!

title: Bored lonely writer looking for friends
text:
I'm Jake, a 23 year old aspiring writer just looking to meet unconventional people. I don't feel like I fit in well with "south bay" culture, and I can't afford to move to anywhere else, so I was hoping to find some like minded people around me. I have a girlfriend in Berkeley but I don't get to be up there all the time so I'd like cool people to hang out with down here.

I'm white, 6'4'', had some college under my belt and a shit-ton of schooling in hard knocks. I'm not much into drinking, drugs, clubbing, cars or whatnot which seems like the majority of southbay folks. I'm an introvert, so sometimes I'm lower energy than I have reason to be, but for the right people I'd do anything to hang out!

Likes: I like hiking, going to write at coffee shops (I'm working on a few scripts, and a book right now, a pipedream I know but I just want to try it out) free music, well written fun movies, people watching, pickup soccer or football, and people who are easy to talk to.

Dislikes: Shallowness, feeling in the way, large crowds, one-sided conversations, "we should hang out sometime in the vague and distant future", feeling the center of attention.

If you want to hang out in a park, coffee shop, walking downtown, poolhall or anywhere else you can think of great! Put your hang-out idea in the subject line, or just the color of your eyes so I know you're real.

title: A listening ear
text:
Hi there,

Want to talk? Want me to listen?

My name is Annette, and I offer free on-line counseling for those in need. I am not licensed but I do have a practitioner's certificate in Solution Focused Brief Therapy. I also have over 14 years of experience helping families come up with solutions to a number of various domestic concerns. 

I can offer an empathetic listening ear, and help brainstorm solutions if you like. Why am I offering free help? Well, first off I really care about people. Second, I would love to have the opportunity to help find realistic solutions for your concerns and problems at hand. I have a couple slots of time available in between my regular work and other projects. I would be honored to help share that time helping you. My goal is to bring peace into this world. Each of us can truly leave a positive imprint here on this planet. We can create a beautiful and peaceful "new earth" one healed soul at a time. 

This is all done primarily via email. On occasion over the phone depending on my daily schedule and availability. Weekends are usually best. 


Topics:
-relationships
-anxiety relief
-depression
-obsessive thinking
-purpose in life
-loneliness

Please reply via email and if you care to talk and I will respond as soon as I am able. 90 percent of the time within a few minutes/hours. Take care and hope to talk with you soon. 

All the best,
Annette

title: Closeted UCSC Trump Supporter seeks Others
text:
I am a student at UCSC. A strange place in every sense in the word. But they like it that way, and for the most part I do too. UC Santa Cruz prides itself on being inclusive to everyone, no matter what their race, religion, orientation, etc. They preech tolerance towards everyone's beliefs... unless they go against their own.

It wasn't until recently (2014) that I was forced to realize what progressive ideals really stood for: Cultural Marxism.

I am looking for other students who have faced or are facing the challenge of fitting in at UCSC. Hopefully there are others like me.

About the header: I do not fully agree with Donald Trump on all of his ideas. But he is the only man running that I trust the most since "coming out".

E-mail with Subject "Can't Stump".

title: "Ditch vision"
text:
Hello,

I'm bookish, a reader and thinker. I write stuff but not in an ego-driven, look-at-me way. I typically come across as quiet. I'm more frequently a pedestrian than a driver, go to libraries more often than bookstores. But I'm not seeking someone identical to myself.

"Ditch vision" is apparently a term coined by an obscure poet (Jeremy Hooker) to refer to the predisposition to seek the miraculous and wondrous in small, mundane things. I identify with that. I guess I'm a practitioner of what you might call "the new parochialism," seeking transcendence (to be transported) here at home, by what's local and specific -- within arm's reach or walking distance.

Anyway, I enjoy walking (wandering on foot), poetic reverie, philosophizing, reading out loud, and so forth. I also enjoy throwing a frisbee in a peaceful way; tennis too, possibly, though honestly it's been a while. And I run (jog) to keep fit.

If you enjoy any of the above, feel free to send me a message. Thanks.

title: Married, once married or in a LTR with a woman
text:
If you're a married man (or once were) or if you're in a long-term relationship with a woman and you'd like a discreet place to discuss your sexuality and form genuine friendships with similar men, please check out the "Married/Once Married Men's Group" that meets weekly at the Pacific Center in Berkeley. It's the only group of its type that meets in the Bay Area.

Although the group is primarily platonic, there have been times in the past when a long-term romance has developed between two members.

One thing the group is NOT is a place to find hook-up partners.

The group is anonymous and the confidentiality of all participants is protected. Current "regulars" range in age from 28 - 68 and the average number of attendees each week is nine. Meetings are every Wednesday night, from 8pm - 9:50pm. The Pacific Center is located at 2712 Telegraph Avenue in Berkeley.

I started attending more than three years ago when I was looking for feedback on coming out to my teenage kids. I didn't expect to attend more than once, but because the guys' feedback was so helpful, I returned to tell them how it went. I've been hooked ever since. I've found my tribe - there's no other social group like it. The dynamic is neither straight nor gay, it's somewhere in between.

I'm posting this information, not because the group needs more participants, but because it's a unique resource that hundreds of men have found invaluable throughout the group's 30+ year history.

title: ISO "just friends"
text:
Hey Guys:

I'm a nice gay man and looking for "Just Friends". Yes, there is the Men Seeking Men section here on CL, but I'm NOT looking for a hookup. I'm looking for other nice, honest, drug free guys, either gay or straight to hang out with, go to a movie, get something to eat together, go for walks with me and my chihuahua named Sadie.

I am on full time disability due to a medical condition, so I do not work, but I went to school at UC Berkeley Adult Extension School and learned how to program databases using a software called Microsoft Access. I now provide database design services for extra money to use to enjoy myself with.

When I am home alone, I enjoy spending quality time with Sadie cuddling and loving her while we watch our favorite TV shows. A far as movies go, I am interested in all types of movies from action and adventure to love stories / romantic films. I would also be interested in going to see shows that are live on stage. I think there is a theater here in Berkeley called the Aroura Theater where they do live stage plays. When I was a kid, I lived in San Jose with my parents and we got season tickets to the The San Jose Civic Light Opera Theater and saw many big named stars in some really great performances. I would LOVE to do that again.

I am interested in meeting other mature acting guys, as I said, either straight or gay who also have a decent sense of humor so we can have a good time together laughing about whatever.........

I am totally open to learning all about you and YOUR personal interests, and who knows, I just might learn something new! After all, isn't that what a true quality friendship is all about is when you learn new things about your friends ?

I'm not necessarily that religious of a guy, but if you are, I am totally open to joining you at your church. If I had to choose, I would say that I believe in Christianity. And I would say that my personal feelings are that all the things in the Bible did not actually happen, but that they are simply stories that make moral points to help guide us in our daily lives. In other words, I do not believe that Moses actually parted the Red Sea, but that story just makes a point. 

YOU BE: 35-55yo, nice, have a good sense of humor, drug free, you don't take life too seriously, but yet you are a very responsible, law abiding guy.

title: Ideal friendship...different outcome. Read entire ad please :)
text:
Getting right to the point this is not facebook...so looking for just friends only here is not the #1 goal. I'm realistic so only respond to me if you can be realistic too. I know most guys online want that 'one thing' on everyone's mind. But I'm different. Honestly I want to take things to the sexual level I'm looking for with you first THEN mix friendship in, to make sure we click on that friendship level after hooking up. I do things my way, not the "normal" way. Try to follow along. Why meet for regular "dates" just to immediately assume that you don't click with someone only because you're so nervous? 

I like to have fun like most guys on these personals but I also like having deep conversations and making actual progress with someone along the way. So no I do not want what others want for their secret agendas; I want a guy that I can get to know a little first over the phone, go to your house to talk and hook up ON THE FIRST MEET, then be prepared to more than potentially have an on-going friendship with benefits if it's there. I'm more than capable of being real friends with real benefits, and am strongly looking for a guy who can be ready enough to follow my lead.

For hanging out I like movies, hiking, shopping, definitely clubbing, can do video games, walking around town, going out to local eateries to avoid fast-food and more. I'm 5'9 tall, masculine, average to thicker/stocky body build, short hair casual attire. Sometimes classy when going out but still masculine. I'm down to earth, funny, open-minded, outspoken, etc. Please be single and not currently attached to someone like your ex. Save the complications.

I do not send face pics, and I am not into judging looks or appearance. Too many people with fake pics and phony intentions, or robots who are simply pic collectors. We can talk on the phone, connect then just meet in person because I have nothing to hide so why try to stop at pictures? In fact I find that the best connections come from not having high expectations off of looks. Instead of being shallow, just be attracted to a personality, not a picture/looks. Race isn't important to me; however I do like being interracial whether it be friendship or more.... Clearly you should feel the same way. I only expect replies from guys who are open-minded about any race. In example, I love Latinos and Asians (yum) but if someone other than that is ringing my bell, then it is what it is :) For the record I'm a top looking for a submissive bttm to be down with who loves sex...and you be able host when we go further or for plan B in the car somewhere parked because I cannot host. Like under the stars chillin'.

Keeping in touch is key...We all have busy lives--you ARE NOT the only one with a busy schedule. If you say you want to meet, just fucking make the time for it and keep the plans. Or else stay the fuck offline. I cannot stress that enough. And back to pictures, it's annoying to exchange pictures with guys who can't follow through or keep the momentum going...if you're claiming to want even just a friend you should already have the time for them. By the way there's no sure way to tell if someone is a match on day 1. Real chemistry doesn't happen in 5 seconds, it happens over time after discovering there are general mutual interests. I want a guy who's prepared to meet with me a few different times before judging any chemistry.

The only real preference for FWB I have is age...I need a guy around my age who can keep up with me. So 18-29 hmu. But since it's a preference not a requirement, older guys feel free to be bold and hmu if you think we can still be good together :)

title: A couple who sweats together....
text:
I weight 240.5 (cant forget .5 right?). When i got out of the Army i weighed aprox. 130lbs., with an eight pack and i look DAMN good, i was also 23; I am now 35 (well will be on Jan. 8th) and i dont wanna be fat anymore. 

I used to be power lifter, well an amatuer one, i didn't lift for anyother reason except to get stronger, i did, but then i got hurt at work, i ballooned from 205lbs. to 204.5lbs., and weak (well weaker than i was, but probably stronger than most). 

I can lift again, i can run again, and most importantly i want to, however it is boring; yes, i can go to the gym for six hours a day, and then walk my dogs for an hour, and inbetween make specific meals (im a Chef; well now dont you feel lucky?) and then sleep for six and...well etc. etc. (it's etc. NOT ect. btw) and i'll lose the weight, and look damn good (i look pretty good now, but perfection can always be perfected...i know, i have high self-esteem, but i promise im not an asshole nor conceited, just self-assured), but it'll get boring and who knows how long it'll last before i go back into my old, lazy ways, 

SO...i am on here (not a bad place btw, but very, VERY eye-opening, and a little weird in certain spots - not saying weird is bad -) trying to find someone who wants to sweat, and work, and moan and groan with me, and as i stated in the subject line : "those who sweat together, sweat in other ways together", and im sure i don't have to specific to relay what i'm saying.

Currently my workout schedule is wideopen, as i still am on Workers Comp., but if i had my druthers, i'd perfer to workout early, early in the AM or late in the evening ie. 3/4am or 10/11pm, HOWEVER i can do it during the day too. I just know that when i go back to work, ill have to change the schedule and i work 0700-1500 in San Leandro, so doing it early in the AM ie. 3/4am would be kick-ass.

The actual workout schedule would simple: running, lifting weights, walking, push-ups/situps, swimming (yes in the winter too) and maybe even some console workouts ie. Wii fitness (i don't actual have this game, but i do do console workouts, why, because they're fun and they make you laugh.

As far as what i'm looking for, i am looking for someone to go on this path me; where it takes us, that's yet to be seen. Maybe we'll just be workout partners, maybe we'll fall in love and maybe...well there's a lot of inbetween, but let's start off with your name (my name is Jacob btw) and coffee.

title: Need anonymous pen-pal type advice from someone in my industry
text:
Just what it says on the tin. Need advice from someone anonymous on the Internet, who has experience in my field

So I graduated law school in 2014. I didn't know it at the time, but I was beginning to be overwhelmed by the tidal wave of bipolar disorder and clinical depression. I had been experiencing the onset of these illnesses for years, but it really came to a breaking point during my law school years. To cut the story short, I completely crashed upon graduating law school. I couldn't hold it together anymore, and consequently have spent the past 2 years trying to figure out just what exactly is my diagnosis (I now have it - bipolar II) and how to manage it.

In that time, I haven't passed the bar, haven't been able to work, haven't been able to do anything but struggle with these demons. It has been a difficult time.

Now as 2016 begins, I'm finally starting to feel like a human being again. And I want my life back. I had a dream to be a lawyer, but now I don't know how to grasp for it or where to start. I have to take the bar exam in June, which will be the Uniform Bar Exam, and then convince a law firm to hire me...but I have no idea how to explain away two blank years on my resume, bad law school grades due to mental illness, and a useless liberal arts background prior to law school. I know I have brains - I got a 170 on the LSAT, which I took just before my mental illness started to really shatter me - but I've learned the hard way that brains aren't enough.

I'm not here looking for someone to give me a job or anything like that. I would just really appreciate some advice and guidance from attorneys who might know what steps I need to take to make myself employable. I did have a dream of working in corporate law, and I actually really loved learning about transactional work in law school, but I am unsure about how to market myself to those big firms. 

Anyway, if you feel like responding, I'd love to hear any pearls of wisdom. If not, thanks for reading anyway. :)

title: not much to it
text:
The truth is much of my life takes place doing simple things like making dinner, taking long drives,enjoying the sun and, when it does, the rain. I find a way to enjoy each moment of simplicity by belting out songs on the radio while driving. What I miss is quiet time to just recharge my batteries. Life is too short to take everything so seriously, so I try to take it in stride and take each moment as it comes. I tend to have a witty (sometimes sarcastic) sense of humor, so anyone I meet needs to be able to keep up and not be easily offended. I'm looking for someone to spend quality times with, because everything is more enjoyable and memorable when you have someone to share them with.

Are you someone that knows when the moment is serious and can engage appropriately?
How to "summarize" oneself or another in a clearly delineated box? The odds of finessing this successfully are slim to none. But here I am and there you have it. At once, infinitely complex and multidimensional and simple at my core, as I think we all are. I am at home and happy in my own skin. Do you find yourself in a similar place? Drawn to those with passions and creative pursuits that fuel and feed them, I find that this life and this world offers immense opportunity for childlike wonder, explosions of pure creativity, eruptions of infinite bliss, and a potent affinity for the absurd amidst all of it.

I am a very curious person and this curiosity manifests itself through travel. New cultures and environments fascinate me and I thrive on meeting new people and learning about their cultures. It's exciting for me to explore and learn about the world and would love to meet someone who enjoys this as well.

I am the kind of person who stays and read the credits at the end of a movie; will let a person cut in front of me at the grocery store if they have just a couple of items to buy, believe in paying it forward and karma. Volunteering is important to me

I have no ulterior motive or agenda. I'm an adult and I expect the same from my partner. Can smoothly transition from most situations with ease (and style), which I hear is a plus.

I am verbal, congenial, and halal. OK, I don't really keep halal. But I liked the rhyme. I love freedom of expression in all forms

So what do you think? Want to give this a whirl?

title: How does one respectfully ask for....
text:
...a stranger to take a chance on meeting?
It's not easy, let me tell you. 
And what if one has a desire to perform acts (or have acts performed on them) that don't conform with the "normal" means of making friends?
You see, I'm not one to make small talk. I'm not well versed in the art of pick-up. Yet I know what I like and want, and yes, I know how to give and please. It's just that I'm not very good at chatting about inconsequential, meaningless things. I prefer deep, probing conversations and intimate physical contact.
Of course we can talk, joke, and get to know each other. But ultimately I want to massage you. Explore you. Experiment with you. Just as I want to be massaged, explored, and experimented with.
People are into so many things, so many acronyms. Edging. BDSM. CFNM. Swinging. Tantra. Voyeurism. Exhibitionism. Anal. Oral. Tech. Hentai. 420. GB. ...on and on. We all have our kinks and fetishes.
This is where I find myself at this moment - I'm curious, feeling the need to experiment and try new and exciting things.
I'm on a quest for Discovery. I seek to discover people, sensations, experiences, boundaries, women. Women in all their glory.
So tell me...what excites you? What intrigues you? Be it sexual, intellectual, emotional, physical or spiritual, I would like to hear about it and possibly experience it with you

title: Seeking local friends!
text:
Hi there!

I'm looking for local girlfriends who live in Mountain View or very near to. Most of my friends live somewhat far away and I would love to make more friends closer to home! Weekdays are best for me, I get very busy on the weekends. 

About me:
I just turned 30, I will be married in four months to the love of my life. I love making new friends and socializing. I love drinking coffee. My friends tend to describe me as being fun, but I know when to take things down a notch and be serious too. I'm not afraid to dance when no one else is. I love to sing karaoke. I love fashion, and own my own business selling designer clothing on eBay. I have a theater background. As a side job, I occasionally work at Stanford school of medicine as a standardized patient, which is basically an acting job to help medical students get out of their textbooks and learn how to talk to patients. I am girly, but a tomboy at heart.

I am a very outgoing person. My personality is very bubbly and happy. I am a Libra, if that means anything to you! My most compatible friendships are usually Leos, Sagittarians, Libras, Gemini and Aquarius. If you happen to be one of those signs, you should totally contact me! (NOT required though, lol!) If that weirded you out, then you probably shouldn't contact me. :P

Fav bands: Florence and the Machine, Beats Antique
Fav movies: I have a lot but to list a few- Moulin Rouge, Lion King, Lord of the Rings, Mary Poppins, Hook, Harry Potter, Back to the Future 
Fav shows: Again, I have a lot, but I will say that I love Doctor Who, Pushing Daisies and Futurama. I like a lot of different shows, for example I just finished watching Crazy Ex-Girlfriend and now I am starting Downton Abbey. It depends on my mood!

I love to learn, I love to read, I love to take walks, I listen to classical music for relaxation, I love to laugh most of all! Life is too short, so I try to live it!

If you live in Mountain View and I didn't scare you off so far, then send me an email! Please tell me more about yourself, it's only fair :P

Talk to you soon, my friend!

title: What's your perspective on this?
text:
I some help understanding something. I'm sure it's a people issue but my recent and past experience has been with women. That's why I'm posting here, looking for perspective. Have you ever known someone that gives so much of herself to people that continue just taking or are constantly needing something? Here is my situation: I'm a very independent guy. Meaning, I don't really need a lot in terms of support, affirmation or so forth. If I'm seeing someone I want their attention simply because if I'm dating them, I really do like them. I had an ex that always went out her way to help out anyone that asked. That could be spending time, loaning money or other efforts. It got to the point where it affected our relationship when she would seemingly drop me to be there for her friend in need. It was a problem because most of her friends where in need of something. It was crazy because she seemed to feel more connected to someone the more they helped them, regardless if it interfered with her own well-being. I just recently experienced that again with a girl in a similar lifestyle. What blows me away is that they both said how easy it was with me. They were both always so at ease when we were together. When we were together, things were amazing but when we weren't, they were bad because they were stressing or completely preoccupied with whatever friend was in need. I will say too, that it wasn't always someone in "need" it was also things like these people were the ones who planned everyone's birthday or other get together and really had to go all out even if they just met or barely knew someone. I don't expect all of someone's time. I know people have lives before they met me. Typically there's a good balance when I date someone and they aren't surrounded by people in constant need. 
So, do I have issues or is it something lacking in their lives? I consider myself a nice guy and I help out friends and I'm there for them but I don't let it affect my happiness. Maybe that's what truly makes them happy but I don't see that. They're stressed, some broke and seem to feel obligated. I just don't get it. Let me know your thoughts.

title: Looking for activity partners to help lose weight
text:
I'm a 31 year old (single, white, if that matters) guy who lives a busy (work)life. I'm a heavy set guy (284lbs, 6'1") and I have been gaining weight a lot lately due to inactivity and unhealthy eating habits. I live in the city and I work in tech industry as a software engineer. I really love my job and that kinda makes me a bit of a workaholic. I don't have much of a life outside of work which often manifests as me staying at the office at late hours. When I'm not working I like to read books(mostly sci-fi), watch tv shows, go to movies, play xbox, catch up on science and technology. When I manage to take time off from work, I really like going for walks around the city and hike the coastal trails.

I'm looking for someone who is in a similar life situation. Basically if any of the following applies:
- busy life and struggles to keep weight down
- makes excuses for not exercising
- really want to get healthy but need a push and someone to motivate you
- are already healthy and/or fit, but would like someone to work on and motivate

I don't care if you're married, in a relationship or single. I would really like to stress that I am not looking for a romantic relationship of any kind and I am not hoping this to develop into anything more than a friendship. No "casual" encounters or anything like that. One thing I do ask is that if you are in a relationship or in a marriage and your partner tends to be jealous kind, I'd ask you to skip this ad. I am all about no drama, and I do not want to spend time making excuses or doing things in secret because of your partner.

What I am looking for is an activity partner for walking, hiking, gym and/or just exploring the city. Basically I would like to find someone I could make plans with to go for walks and have an excuse to not stay at work so late. :)

Just send me a mail and we can get to know each other a little better and go for a coffee or something. I'm not a creep and I'd also like to verify that you're not one, so meeting in a public place first would be ideal.

title: Are you a hoarder or understand hoarders?
text:
Hi there thanks for clicking on my ad.

I'm a hoarder and it makes me very embarrassed and ashamed. Since I'm uncomfortable inviting people over or even letting them know about my situation, it makes me distance myself from people, afraid of being rejected by them if they were ever to find out. But that also makes me very lonely, and even though I sometimes think that no one could accept me for this one thing, I believe that I do have qualities that I could offer someone, kind, caring, affectionate, reasonably intelligent, not unattractive (I guess, beauty is in the eye of the beholder, my exes thought I was attractive). I think it also makes it harder being gay too. Gay guys have the stereotype of being super tidy and put together. I'm not either of those. 

I know it probably sounds like I'm looking for something romantic, and I'm not opposed to it, but I'm posting in Strictly Platonic because I really am just trying to find people who are supportive and can help me, people that'll show me that there are people out there that won't run away if they find out I'm a hoarder. 

If you made it this far, thanks so much for reading. Sorry it's such a long ad. If you feel that you'd be willing to reach out and help me, that would be great. Thanks!

title: Why "She Loves You" is the Beatles Best Song
text:
Just love that song. Can't feel depressed after hearing it. It's the best Beatles song because it's impossible from listening to it to know who wrote it. With the Beatles, usually the lead singer is also the writer. On "She Loves You," McCartney and Lennon both sing a harmonized lead. In fact, they both played a hand in writing it, unlike many of their other songs, which were written by one or the other. For a group that was so much more than the sum of its parts, "She Loves You" exemplifies what made the Beatles great.

You could comment on that or just put into the subject line something you'd like to talk about. I'm into music, films, politics, money, etc. Often bored, always looking to converse.

I have a table and studio in marin, A free massage, who could ask for anything better! 
(What's the catch?)

This is for therapeutic massage, I need the practice, feel free to email
me for more information. I look forward to hearing from you and working
with you to heal and come back to wholeness.

Your blissful massage awaits : )

title: Hiking, walking, boating friends wanted
text:
I am looking for a friend who want to work out walk talk,etc.
Moving to marin from SF has been a transition and a half.
I use too live on twin peaks and would walk around the
tower pretty often with friends, now I am in need of a friend
who wants to do some physical stuff, especially hiking
the fabulous hills and mountains of marin. I prefer 20-40 yr
old people as its easier for me to connect. Lets me know
if your interested with a email and maybe a photo and
we can start a new healthy chapter of our lives.

Cheers!
Jackson

title: Fun kik chat
text: A fun group of people just kiking it. Please have a sense of humor to enter. Message urwelcome001 or prettykittymp on kik to request to join.

title: everything but the sex
text:
In the N Bay area or another couple of weeks, maybe a month. Looking for all the perks of a relationship w out the complications. Maybe go for bike ride, paddle out or just hang out at beach, dinner, spend the night, tweeze each others back hair all that shit you associate w a relationship except Im only in the Bay for a few months outa the year and not really looking for a long term anything. 
Ill treat you nice, promise. Have a few references for a few girls Ive non-sexually dated cause we all know the "gay"/"yoga teacher"/"just looking for friends on teenybopper.com" routine....
Im not looking for type person in particular, more personality, ability to converse about more then just top trending google searches. any body from high school to hospice, just smell nice cause I like the idea of sleeping next to someone....Im from Hawaii and don't believe in a/c so snuggle season is something special, gotta get it.

title: Seeking workout/running buddy
text:
Need to get back into shape and it would be much more enjoyable with a friend for some motivation and to pass the time better. 

Im a 31 year old caucasian male, not out of shape, just need to get my wind back and strengthen up a bit. Would be nice if you were in the Foster City, San Mateo area or close to that. 

Tell me about yourself and activities you'd like to do for exercise and we'll go from there.
